controls.label: Do you have any customers who are individuals (including sole traders)?
Does your AML/CTF program include appropriate risk-based systems and controls designed to enable you to be reasonably satisfied that individual customers are who they claim to be?
controls.detail-label: Describe your risk-based systems and controls for customer identity satisfaction

controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program include a procedure to collect minimum KYC information for individuals (full name, date of birth, and residential address)?
controls.detail-label: Describe your procedure for collecting minimum KYC information from individuals who are not sole traders

controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program include a procedure to collect minimum KYC information for sole traders (full name, date of birth, business name, business/residential address, and ABN)?
controls.detail-label: Describe your procedure for collecting minimum KYC information from sole traders

controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program include appropriate risk-based systems and controls to determine whether additional KYC information beyond the minimum should be collected?
controls.detail-label: Describe your risk-based approach to determining when to collect additional KYC information

controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program include a procedure to verify the customer's full name and either date of birth or residential address (or both)?
controls.detail-label: Describe your procedure for verifying minimum KYC information

controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program require that verification be based on reliable and independent documentation, reliable and independent electronic data, or a combination of both?
controls.detail-label: Describe what sources your program accepts as reliable and independent for verification purposes

controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program include appropriate risk-based systems and controls to determine whether additional KYC information beyond the minimum should be verified?
controls.detail-label: Describe your risk-based approach to determining when to verify additional KYC information

controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program include appropriate risk-based systems and controls to respond to discrepancies that arise during verification so you can determine whether you are reasonably satisfied of the customer's identity?
controls.detail-label: Describe your procedure for handling verification discrepancies

controls.label: For medium or lower ML/TF risk customers, do you use the documentation-based safe harbour verification procedure?
Does your safe harbour procedure require collection of the minimum KYC information specified in 4.2.3 or 4.2.4?

Does your safe harbour procedure require verification of the customer's name and either residential address or date of birth (or both) from either: (a) an original or certified copy of a primary photographic ID document, OR (b) both a primary non-photographic ID document and a secondary ID document?
controls.detail-label: Describe what identification documents your safe harbour procedure accepts

controls.label: Does your safe harbour procedure require verification that any document produced has not expired (except Commonwealth passports expired within the preceding two years)?
For medium or lower ML/TF risk customers, do you use the electronic-based safe harbour verification procedure?
Does your electronic safe harbour procedure require collection of the minimum KYC information specified in 4.2.3 or 4.2.4?

Does your electronic safe harbour procedure require verification of the customer's name and either residential address, date of birth, or both, OR verification that the customer has a transaction history for at least 3 years?
controls.detail-label: Describe your electronic verification approach (name + address/DOB, or transaction history)

controls.label: For electronic safe harbour verification, does your procedure require using reliable and independent electronic data from at least two separate data sources?
controls.detail-label: List the electronic data sources your procedure uses for verification

groups.title: Customer Due Diligence — Individuals
groups.description: This form covers all customer identification procedures for individual customers, including sole traders. Complete all relevant sections based on your customer base and risk assessment.

groups.title: General CDD Obligation
groups.description: Determine whether your AML/CTF program must include procedures for individual customers.

groups.title: Collection of KYC Information
groups.description: Procedures for collecting minimum and additional know-your-customer information from individuals.

groups.title: Verification of Information
groups.description: Procedures for verifying the identity information collected from individual customers.

groups.title: Additional KYC Assessment
groups.description: Risk-based determination of what additional information should be collected or verified beyond minimum requirements.

groups.title: Discrepancy Handling
groups.description: Procedures for responding to discrepancies discovered during the verification process.

groups.title: Safe Harbour Procedures — Documentation-Based Verification
groups.description: Optional simplified procedure using identity documents for medium or lower ML/TF risk customers.

groups.title: Safe Harbour Procedures — Electronic Verification
groups.description: Optional simplified procedure using electronic data sources for medium or lower ML/TF risk customers.
